page.title: 09Langford School and Dinners.
page.content: St.Christopher's Primary School in Langford has seventy one children and three teachers,which includes the Head. There is a part-time secretary and a part-time classroom helper. There are two ladies who serve the dinners and another two who supervise the children during their lunch hour. The school starts at 9am. and goes on until 3pm. Dinner starts at 12noon and the children can buy a school dinner, costing 65p a day, or take packed lunch or they can go home if they live in the village.The children also have a short afternoon and morning playtime. The school dinners are cooked in a large school in Carterton. During the morning they are brought by van to the school.Containers keep the food hot.On a day in June the children were served fish cakes, boiled potatoes,and tinned tomatoes followed by trifle pudding.
